data.title: Scientists modify tomatoes to make them 'significantly sweeter'
data.description: HONG KONG — Chinese scientists have successfully modified tomatoes to make them sweeter by removing two genes that regulate sugar content, according to a new study.

data.title: Siam City Cement Group (SCCC) reports strong Q3 2024 performance with 79% net profit growth
data.description: Siam City Cement Group (SCCC) announced an impressive Q3 2024 financial performance, showcasing a substantial YoY net profit surged by 79% to THB 790 million and YoY EBITDA growth at 15%.

data.title: Siam City Cement Group (SCCC) Reports Strong Q3 2024 Performance with 79% Net Profit Growth
data.description: Siam City Cement Group (SCCC) announced an impressive Q3 2024 financial performance, showcasing a substantial YoY net profit surged by 79% to THB 790 million and YoY EBITDA growth at 15%. This growth is driven by lower input costs, successful cost-control measures, efficiency improvements under the Group’s “FIT+” initiative, and a strong recovery in key markets, including Vietnam and Sri Lanka.

data.title: Paetongtarn to visit Malaysia to boost ties, trade
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra will visit Malaysia next month in a bid to further strengthen ties and boost trade while also working on improving border security.

data.title: From Basque country to Bangkok
data.description: Chef Yoshitsugu Yamamoto, owner of Michelin-starred Alarde in Osaka, Japan, is set to make waves in Bangkok this month with an exclusive two-night guest shift on Nov 21 and 22 at UNO MAS at Centara Grand at CentralWorld.

data.title: EC explains new PAO poll date
data.description: The election of chairs and members of Provincial Administrative Organisations (PAOs) will be held on Saturday, Feb 1, instead of Sunday, Feb 2, in a bid to ensure the vote runs smoothly given the legal limitations outlined in the election law, EC commissioner Santhat Siriananpaiboon says.

data.title: Local stars in with a chance to shine at LPGA Thailand again
data.description: Honda is set to bring global golf excitement to Thailand once again as the prestigious Honda LPGA Thailand 2025 will take place between Feb 20-23 at the iconic Siam Country Club, Old Course, in Pattaya next year.

data.title: Prolonged floods in Chiang Mai raise subsidence risk
data.description: Experts are warning of possible landslides and subsidence in parts of Chiang Dao district in Chiang Mai, as the ground in the area is saturated with water after two months of floods.
